The Sri Lankan Constitution of 1972 is the constitution of Sri Lanka. It is Sri 
Lanka's first republican constitution, and its second constitution since the 
independence of the country in 1948. The constitution changed the country's 
name to Sri Lanka from Ceylon, and proclaimed it as an independent republic 
nation. ... The new constitution was promulgated on 22 May 1972.
